div.l: Thus haue I quyt the Miller in my tale
Here endith the Reues tale 
Here begynneth the Prolog of the Cokes tale · //
The Cook of london while the Reue spak
For ioye hym thought he clowid hȳm on þe bak
Ha ha qᵈuod he for cristes passion
This Miller hath a scharp conclusion
Vp on his argument of herbigage
Well seide Salamon in his langage
Ne bryng not eủery man in to thyn hous
Fo herberwyng be nyght is ꝑperilous
Well ought a man a vised for to be
Whom that he brought in to his pryuete
I pray to god so yeue me sorwen ⁊and care
If eủer sithen I hight hogge of ware
Herde I Miller better sette a werke
He had a iape of malice in the derke
And therfore if ye vouche saf to here
But god for bede that we stynte here
A tale of me that am a pore man
I woll you telle as well as eủer I can
A litull iape that fill in our Cite
Our oost answerde ⁊and seide I graūnte it the
Now telle on Roger loke that it be good
